task_summary: Detect the T-block and target outline, align the circular tool, and execute a sequence of pushes (leftward then slight diagonal) until the block reaches the target region; then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows a UR-style arm with a cylindrical (circular) end-effector pushing a red T-shaped block across a white surface toward a drawn T outline. The robot must perceive both the block and the target region, align its tool to the push direction, and move the block by controlled, short pushes. The plan favors simple perception plus iterative pushes with bounded timeouts. After reaching the target, the robot briefly stabilizes and retreats to clear the workspace. Timing constraints suggest a modest control cadence, but execution relies on discrete BT ticks.
preconditions: Workspace is clear around the T block and target outline
Camera provides sufficient visibility of block and target
Robot reachable workspace covers start and goal regions
stepwise_plan: Detect the T block and the target outline.
Move above the block and align the tool to the push axis.
Perform a primary leftward push toward the outline.
Refine with shorter pushes; add a slight diagonal push if needed.
Verify target visibility and alignment near the outline.
Wait briefly and retreat to a safe distance.
success_criteria: Block rests within the target T outline with acceptable orientation
No collisions with fixtures or table edges
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected: re-run detection or adjust view.
If misaligned: re-run alignment step before pushing.
If overshoot: perform corrective push in opposite direction.
If slip occurs: reduce push distance and retry.
task_long_description.termination: Behavior terminates when verification near the target completes and the robot retreats from contact.

frame_4.now_evidence: Clear first push with tool contacting the T block along leftward axis.
frame_4.predicts_next: Further short pushes or slight diagonal correction expected.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool aligned at contact edge; alignment preceding push is visible.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above block to safe approach height.
Align tool to pushing edge of block.
Orient tool yaw for leftward push.
Back off to clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to lighting or occlusion
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection from a slightly different viewpoint
Re-align using ApproachAndAlign before next push
Apply opposite-direction micro-push to correct overshoot
Reduce push distance and increase verification frequency
assumptions: Frames show a RED T block and BLUE outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—frames preferred.
Push direction largely leftward with minor diagonal correction (225°) based on observed motion.
10Hz observation/control implied; library exposes only timeouts, so cadence is approximated via discrete action timeouts.

expected_success_criteria: Final block pose fully inside the drawn T outline
Stable block pose for at least one tick
